column1: Care Activities
Receive patient admission report
Complete intake process (confirm non-clinical/demographic information)
Coordinate referrals to complete discipline specific intake/consent.
Confirm if MOST exists, flag if not
Prepare for patient admission - (room cleaning)
Prepare for patient admission - room set up (basic supplies)
Prepare for patient admission (patient specific needs - equipment)
Prepare for patient admission (patient specific needs - psychosocial/spiritual, translation services, cultural safety)
Orientate patient and family to unit and hospital
Screen for patient ability to perform ADLs.
Assess for patient ability to complete ADLs.
Assist with patient personal care tasks to support activities of daily living
Perform patient personal care tasks to support activities of daily living
Encourage patient to complete personal care tasks to support activities of daily living (as directed in careplan)
Trim nails on hands/feet (no chronic conditions)
Trim nails on hands/feet (chronic conditions)
Apply therapeutic hot applications (as directed in care plan).
Apply therapeutic cold applications (as directed in care plan).
Insert hearing aid
Screen for patient ability to perform instrumental activities of daily living (iADsL)
Assess for patient ability to perform instrumental activities of daily living (IADL)
Refer to community resources for support for ADLs/iADLs
Assess peripheral pulses using ultrasound (i.e. Doppler Ultrasound)
Apply doppler ultrasound to assist with assessment of peripheral pulses
Set up continuous electrocardiogram monitoring
Monitor continuous electrocardiogram monitoring
Assess continuous electrocardiogram monitoring
Prescribe blood and blood products
Administer blood and blood products
Insert short peripheral intravenous access
Administer continuous or intermittent intravenous therapy (substances not drugs/ medications)
Administer continuous or intermittent intravenous therapy (prescribed drugs/ medications not including controlled drugs and substances)
Administer continuous or intermittent intravenous therapy (prescribed drugs/ medications  including controlled drugs and substances)
Obtain blood sample performing venipuncture
Transport collected blood specimens from the collection area to the site laboratory
Administer prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs) by any method
Administer controlled drugs and substances (schedule 1A drugs) by any method)
Obtain Best Possible Medication History
Compound prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs)
Compound controlled drugs and substance (schedule 1A drugs)
Dispense controlled drugs and substance (schedule 1A drugs)
Dispense prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs)
Prescribe controlled drugs and substance (schedule 1A drugs)
Prescribe prescription drugs (schedule 1 drugs)
Screen for mobility ambulation
Screen for bed mobility
Screen for mobility transfers
Assess patient repositioning including turns
Assist with patient repositioning
Assess patient transfers
Assist with patient transfer (with mechanical aids (e.g. slings, lifts)
Assist with patient transfer (without mechanical aids)
Transfer patient (with mechanical aids)
Transfer patient (without mechanical aids)
Position patient in bed
Assist with patient positioning in bed
Monitor physical restraints (i.e., soft, hard, lock)
Assess need for patient physical restraints - LC
Assist registered health professional with application of physical restraints (i.e., soft, hard, lock)
Screen patient for risk factors for falls and fall-related injuries
Assess patient for risk factors for falls and fall-related injuries
Observe and report risk of falls
Conduct spasticity assessment
Screens patient mobility (e.g. pre-handling checklist)
Assess patient functional mobility and determine level of complexity
Assess patient for ongoing functional and therapeutic mobilization
Assess patient mobility (complex) for the purpose of monitoring a patient's progress as documented in care plan
Develop mobility/musculoskeletal care plan based on assessment
Assists with mobility/functional, range of motion and strength exercises
Assess patient need for mobility aids
Prescribe mobility aids (medical device) based on assessment
Assist with assessment of patient need for mobility aids
Take an x-ray image of the indicated body part of the patient at their bed location using a portable x-ray machine
Remove staples and sutures
Screen for cognitive/mental status (as directed in careplan)
Assess cognitive/mental status
Screen for motor strength and equality
Assess for motor strength and equality
Screen for movement and sensation
Assess for movement and sensation
Provide non-pharmacological delirium prevention activities
Measure and record height and weight
Measure and record intake and output
Obtain blood sample performing capillary puncture for the purpose of monitoring blood glucose levels
Assess blood glucose levels based on capillary blood sample
Prescribe enteral nutrition
Design a therapeutic diet for nutrition admistered by enteral instillation
Administer a therapeutic diet for nutrition by enteral instillation
Compound a therapeutic diet for nutrition administered by enteral instillation
Dispense a therapeutic diet for nutrition administered by enteral instillation
Prescribe parenteral nutrition
Design a therapeutic diet for nutrition admistered by parenteral instillation
Administer a therapeutic diet for nutrition by parenteral instillation
Compound a therapeutic diet for nutrition administered by parenteral instillation
Dispense a therapeutic diet for nutrition administered by parenteral instillation
Screen patient swallowing technique
Assess patient swallowing technique (instrumental)
Assess patient swallowing technique (non-instrumental)
Assist patient with swallow techniques/exercises
Provide nutrition information and education to patient
Perform digital rectal examination
Perform rectal stimulation
Empty gastrointestinal ostomy collection pouch
Change ostomy appliance (e.g., colostomy, ileostomy)
Assess urine output (e.g. amount, color, viscosity)
Insert intermittent and indwelling urinary catheter
Initiate continuous bladder irrigation
Assess for incontinence
Initiate interventions for incontinence
Perform urine dipstick at bedside
Administer and titrate supplemental oxygen (low flow nasal prongs)
Administer and titrate supplemental oxygen (high flow nasal prongs)
Administer and titrates supplemental oxygen (Continuous positive airway pressure)
Administer and titrates supplemental oxygen (Bilevel positive airway pressure)
Inserts and remove nasopharyngeal airways
Manage nasopharyngeal airways
Perform nasopharyngeal suctioning.
Perform oropharyngeal suctioning
Screen patient communication including voice, receptive and expressive language and speech abilities.
Assess patient communication including voice, receptive and expressive language and speech abilities.
Establish and implement appropriate strategies/interventions for patient’s communication and speech deficits
Assist patient with interventions for communication and speech deficits.
Establishes substitute decision maker informed by Health Care Consent Act and Advance Care Planning
Facilitates Advanced Care Planning conversations
Conducts initial and ongoing psychosocial assessment
Advocates and negotiates patient and family rights and inclusion honouring diversity in health care system
Provides specific support for patient/family’s beliefs/spiritual needs
